articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, JACK JEFFERY and LEE KEATH
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli troops fought with Hamas militants on the edges of Gaza City on Thursday, as the Palestinian death toll rose above 9,000.
articles.title: Pressure rises on Israel to pause fighting and ease siege as battles intensify near Gaza City

articles.author: ISABEL DEBRE and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — More than 3,600 Palestinian children were killed in the first 25 days of the war between Israel and Hamas, according to Gaza's Hamas-run Health Ministry.
articles.title: ‘A curse to be a parent in Gaza’: More than 3,600 Palestinian children killed in just 3 weeks of war

articles.author: MARY CLARE JALONICK, TARA COPP and LOLITA BALDOR
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. Senate, circumventing holds by Republican Sen. Tommy Tuberville, on Thursday confirmed the nominations of two senior military leaders, including the first female member of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
articles.title: US Senate circumvents Tuberville holds and confirms new Air Force head, first female on Joint Chiefs

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ and MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Gaming giant Bally's paid Donald Trump’s company $60 million to buy the right to operate a public golf course in New York City, the former president's namesake son testified Thursday.
articles.title: Trial testimony reveals gambling giant Bally's paid $60 million to take over Trump's NYC golf course

articles.author: CHRISTINE FERNANDO and NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: ST. PAUL, Minn. (AP) — Minnesota Supreme Court justices appeared skeptical Thursday that states have the authority to block former President Donald Trump from the ballot, with some suggesting that Congress is best positioned to decide whether his role in the 2021 U.S.
articles.title: Minnesota justices appear skeptical that states should decide Trump's eligibility for the ballot

articles.author: JONATHAN MATTISE and TRAVIS LOLLER
articles.description: MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) — A former Memphis police officer pleaded guilty Thursday in the fatal beating of Tyre Nichols, becoming the first of five officers charged to reverse course, with prosecutors recommending up to 15 years in prison.
articles.title: Former Memphis police officer pleads guilty to federal charges in Tyre Nichols’ death

articles.author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ and MICHAEL BALSAMO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Federal agents on Thursday raided the home of a top fundraiser and longtime confidante to New York City Mayor Eric Adams, who abruptly ditched a planned White House meeting and flew home from Washington.
articles.title: Federal agents search home of fundraiser for New York City Mayor Eric Adams

articles.author: MIKE STOBBE and MATTHEW PERRONE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Fewer high school students are vaping this year, the government reported Thursday.In a survey, 10% of high school students said they had used electronic cigarettes in the previous month, down from 14% last year.
articles.title: Vaping by high school students dropped this year, says US report

articles.author: MARIA SHERMAN
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The final Beatles recording is here.Titled “Now and Then,” the almost impossible-to-believe track is four minutes and eight seconds of the first and only original Beatles recording of the 21st century.
articles.title: Listen to the last new Beatles' song with John, Paul, George, Ringo and AI tech: 'Now and Then'

articles.author: STEPHEN WHYNO and PAT GRAHAM
articles.description: It took the NHL until 1979 to mandate helmets and goalie masks for new players. It wasn't until 2013 that eye-protecting visors became mandatory — grandfathered in for veterans, of course.
articles.title: Death of a player from a skate to the neck reignites hockey's stubborn debate over protective gear
